32.bss: - Cheé mod átə́ŋgɛ́né abɛl nzé akóbé mɔ́?

33.bss: - Cheé mod átə́ŋgɛ́né abɛl nzé akóbé mɔ́?

43.bss: Coronavirus, awalɛɛ awe béchəgɛɛ́ ámpē bán COVID-19, adíi nkole mékɔ̄ɔ̄lē. Ḿme nkole ńsémpé abooted á aloŋ á China á epun 31 á ngɔn e December 2019. Ndíi nkole ḿme nzé ńkóbe mod, mpɛɛne ahéb, ńchede mod yə̌l áte, ḿbɛle yə̌l éwāg mod áte, ńkɔ̄lēʼe mod peme. Ńkábné nkǒŋsē áte ńsyə̄ə̄l. Modmod eébīīʼé wɛ́ɛ ḿme nkole nkóó abíd.
43.en: Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.

44.bss: Coronavirus, awalɛɛ awe béchəgɛɛ́ ámpē bán COVID-19, adíi nkole mékɔ̄ɔ̄lē. Ḿme nkole ńsémpé abooted á aloŋ á China á epun 31 á ngɔn e December 2019. Ndíi nkole ḿme nzé ńkóbe mod, mpɛɛne ahéb, ńchede mod yə̌l áte, ḿbɛle yə̌l éwāg mod áte, ńkɔ̄lēʼe mod peme. Ńkábné nkǒŋsē áte ńsyə̄ə̄l. Modmod eébīīʼé wɛ́ɛ ḿme nkole nkóó abíd.

54.bss: Mod awě awóó nkole mé nlém
54.en: Person with a heart condition or disease

55.bss: Mod awě awóó nkole mé nlém
55.en: Person with a heart condition or disease

56.bss: Ḿmɛ́n nkole mékɔ̄ɔ̄le ńkóbe ké nzɛ́ɛ́; mésɔ́nɛɛ́ kɔ̂d. Boŋ pɛn ḿbâg ngíne á yə̌l wɛ́ɛ bechun bé bad ne bad ábe nkole mêmpée ńsébpé abɛ́ áyə̄l (nkole nêngáne nkole ḿme ńkɔ́le mod pemɛ, nkole ḿ bɔmbe, nkole mé nlém, nkole ḿme ńchə́gte mod mekií).
56.en: People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.

57.bss: Ḿmɛ́n nkole mékɔ̄ɔ̄le ńkóbe ké nzɛ́ɛ́; mésɔ́nɛɛ́ kɔ̂d. Boŋ pɛn ḿbâg ngíne á yə̌l wɛ́ɛ bechun bé bad ne bad ábe nkole mêmpée ńsébpé abɛ́ áyə̄l (nkole nêngáne nkole ḿme ńkɔ́le mod pemɛ, nkole ḿ bɔmbe, nkole mé nlém, nkole ḿme ńchə́gte mod mekií).
57.en: People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.

58.bss: Ḿmɛ́n nkole mékɔ̄ɔ̄le ńkóbe ké nzɛ́ɛ́; mésɔ́nɛɛ́ kɔ̂d. Boŋ pɛn ḿbâg ngíne á yə̌l wɛ́ɛ bechun bé bad ne bad ábe nkole mêmpée ńsébpé abɛ́ áyə̄l (nkole nêngáne nkole ḿme ńkɔ́le mod pemɛ, nkole ḿ bɔmbe, nkole mé nlém, nkole ḿme ńchə́gte mod mekií).
58.en: People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.

69.bss: Eʼchemléd bé nkole ń coronavirus éʼdé melemlem nɛ́ɛ nkole ḿme mpɛɛnad mod: ahéb, ekə́rid éche ébīdē, eʼwɛ éʼ yə̌l áte, eʼchiited é̀ʼ yə̌l áte. Donge á bad béwóge eʼwɛ, nhentɛn, runny nose, eʼwɛ á nkə́ŋ-tê, abúú. Baahɔ́gke ámpē béwóoʼ ḿme nkole boŋ béēwóó eʼchemléd ké eʼhɔ́g. Bad híin béwóo ḿme nkole áde béebɛnledɛɛ́ kəse e bwɛl ké pɔ́g.
69.en: The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

70.bss: Eʼchemléd bé nkole ń coronavirus éʼdé melemlem nɛ́ɛ nkole ḿme mpɛɛnad mod: ahéb, ekə́rid éche ébīdē, eʼwɛ éʼ yə̌l áte, eʼchiited é̀ʼ yə̌l áte. Bad híin béwóo ḿme nkole áde béebɛnledɛɛ́ kəse e bwɛl ké pɔ́g.
70.en: The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

71.bss: Eʼchemléd bé nkole ń coronavirus éʼdé melemlem nɛ́ɛ nkole ḿme mpɛɛnad mod: ahéb, ekə́rid éche ébīdē, eʼwɛ éʼ yə̌l áte, eʼchiited é̀ʼ yə̌l áte. Donge á bad béwóge eʼwɛ, nhentɛn, runny nose, eʼwɛ á nkə́ŋ-tê, abúú. Baahɔ́gke ámpē béwóoʼ ḿme nkole boŋ béēwóó eʼchemléd ké eʼhɔ́g. Bad híin béwóo ḿme nkole áde béebɛnledɛɛ́ kəse e bwɛl ké pɔ́g.
71.en: The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

76.bss: Mod awě awóó COVID-19 mɔ́ akobtan bad bémpée. Nzé mod awe awóó ḿme nkole akədté kéʼɛ asámé, melêd mébide mɔ́ á nsəl kéʼɛ mebɔm mébíd mɔ́ á duú. Nzé m̀mê melêd kéʼɛ mebɔm mékíí mod ampée á nsəl kéʼɛ á duú ḿme nkole ḿbɛlé ńkób mɔ́. Kéʼɛ nzé mod asiítɛ́né kéhéé wɛ́ɛ ḿme melêd kéʼɛ mebɔm métɛ́né, boŋ atedé echê ekáá asiitɛné mǐd, dúu kéʼɛ nsəl, ḿme nkole ńhɛlese ńkōb mɔ́.
76.en: COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

77.bss: Mod awě awóó COVID-19 mɔ́ akobtan bad bémpée. Nzé mod awe awóó ḿme nkole akədté kéʼɛ asámé, melêd mébide mɔ́ á nsəl kéʼɛ mebɔm mébíd mɔ́ á duú. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

89.bss: 1. Wɛɛ́ kɛɛné ekáá á mǐd, á duú ne á nsəl.

90.bss: 1. Wɛɛ́ kɛɛné ekáá á mǐd, á duú ne á nsəl.

91.bss: 1. Wɛɛ́ kɛɛné ekáá á mǐd, á duú ne á nsəl.

94.bss: 2. Éwobpe mekáá póndé tɛ́ɛ́ ne sɔ́pɛ. Nzé ewǒbpé mekáá epine ne abad áde ásáá.
94.en: 2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.

95.bss: 2. Éwobpe mekáá póndé tɛ́ɛ́ ne sɔ́pɛ. Nzé ewǒbpé mekáá epine ne abad áde ásáá.
95.en: 2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.

102.bss: 4. Weésitán nyam eche béechamɛɛ́ kéʼɛ nyam éche ékag.
102.en: 4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.

103.bss: 4. Weésitán nyam eche béechamɛɛ́ kéʼɛ nyam éche ékag.
103.en: 4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.

112.bss: 5. Nzé mod a kədte kéʼɛ asámeʼ ésyə̄ə̄ mɔ́ á nkəg dyam mɛta mehɔ́g.

113.bss: 5. Nzé mod a kədte kéʼɛ asámeʼ ésyə̄ə̄ mɔ́ á nkəg dyam mɛta mehɔ́g.

117.bss: 6. Weesómé bad ekáá áte. Nzé elɛnte mod eláá mɔ dásɔ̄ dyam kéʼɛ elúmtɛ́n mɔ́ yə̌l.
117.en: 6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.

118.en: 6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.

129.bss: 9. Ésɛdte mam ḿme métə́ŋgé tə̂ŋgɛne ḿme nkole.
129.en: 9. Keep informed and verify the source of information.

130.bss: 9. Ésɛdte mam ḿme métə́ŋgé tə̂ŋgɛne ḿme nkole.

144.bss: Mod ké ahéé átédɛn eche yə̌l póndé ábɛleʼɛ mam ḿme melûmte bán akəŋge eche yə̌l ne bad ábe bédé mɔ́ bɛnbɛn.
144.en: Everyone must be responsible and take the right steps to protect themselves and those around them.

145.bss: Mod ké ahéé átédɛn eche yə̌l póndé ábɛleʼɛ mam ḿme melûmte bán akəŋge eche yə̌l ne bad ábe bédé mɔ́ bɛnbɛn.
145.en: Everyone must be responsible and take the right steps to protect themselves and those around them.
